content: sherri crochets & crafts proudly presents five sassy critters pattern patterns designed by sherri bush copyright may 2006 these patterns may not be distributed or sold by anyone other than myself you may make and construct these patterns and sell what you make from these patterns but you may not sell or give away the pattern itself page 1 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com five sassy critters patterns pattern difficulty medium i assume you already know how to crochet how to crochet in the round how to read a pattern and how to sew pieces together supplies size g hook to make critters on cover page on the left one skein of 4 ply yarn red heart super saver works nicely feel free to be creative and use more than one color make paws two colors make the tail a different color or i like to make one ear a different color gauge is unimportant for this project terms single_crochet = single_crochet increase = increase two single_crochet in same stitch decrease = decrease crochet two stitches together note these critters are worked in the round i join rounds and i single_crochet in the same space as joining so i m assuming that at the end of each round you are slip stitching to the first stitch of that round and that you chain 1 to start the next round you can work in spirals if that s easier for you just remember to mark your rounds you want your stitches tight and close together so the stuffing doesn t show through later on to start each piece you can chain 2 and work your 6 stitches into the 2nd stitch from the hook or you can use the magic magic_ring ideas it s also fun to use a bigger hook and a baby eyelash yarn held together to make a fuzzy animal like critters on cover page on left or my son used two strands of yarn and a larger hook to make a larger animal or it was suggested to me to use crochet thread and a tiny hook to make miniature animals the same head body arms and legs are used for all animals you ll use different ears and tails to make different animals be creative and have fun page 2 of 11 copyright by sherri bush http //www ravelry com/designers/sherri-bush sherricrochets@gmail com basic head use for all critters row instruction stitches 1 chain 2 6 single_crochet in second chain from hook join chain 1 6 2 *2 single_crochet in each single_crochet* around
